resources.string: Tour Guide App
Landmark 17th-century Mughal fortress built in towering red sandstone, now a complex of museums.
73m tapering tower built in 1193 by Qutab-ud-din Aibak after defeat of Delhi last Hindu kingdom.
Opulent red-sandstone tomb of Mughal Emperor Humayun, built in 1572 and surrounded by formal gardens.
Imposing Arc de Triomphe-style gate commemorating the Indian soliders killed in the First World War.
It is one of the best north Indian restaurant in delhi.
Upmarket hotel venue serving cuisine from the countries that the Orient Express travels through.
Enjoying this market region is like a small adventure tours. There are alleys and narrow passages.
The articles of this market usually comprises of rejected goods from the packages sent for export.
It is popularly known for offering an array of gorgeous bridal wears and traditional Indian garments.
The busiest of all the shopping places of Delhi is Connaught Place. This shopping place looks great with its white appearance.
Contemporary twists on Indian cuisine are served at this stylish, prize-winning restaurant.
Upscale hotel refined yet relaxed Italian restaurant with a wood-fired oven and white wall tiling.
This is a beautiful, lush green park with a smattering of water bodies here and there, and a few fountains.
This is not just a park, it is a space with a variety of activities, inviting public interaction and exploration.
Located in South Delhi, this Park is a popular spot for walkers and runners, and is also a good chillout spot on the weekends.
India Gate is a famous landmark in Delhi. This gardens are a popular chillout spot for the locals in Delhi.
